Class Projectile

java.lang.Object
sk.stuba.fiit.GameObject
sk.stuba.fiit.entities.Entity
sk.stuba.fiit.projectiles.Projectile
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, Cloneable, Damageable, Mortal
Direct Known Subclasses:
EnemyProjectile, PlayerProjectile
public abstract class Projectile extends Entity implements Cloneable
Represents a projectile in the game, which extends the Entity class. A projectile is an entity that moves in a specific direction and deals damage upon collision. It can be cloned and can be customized with various attacking strategies and movement speeds.

  • Constructor Details

    • Projectile

      public Projectile(String name, String description, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture, int health, int maxHealth, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 direction, float speed, int damage)
      Constructor for the Projectile class. Initializes the projectile with the specified properties.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the projectile
      description - the description of the projectile
      texture - the texture for the projectile's visual representation
      health - the initial health of the projectile
      maxHealth - the maximum health of the projectile
      direction - the initial direction of the projectile
      speed - the speed at which the projectile moves
      damage - the damage the projectile will deal upon collision

    • move

      public void move(float deltaTime)
      Moves the projectile based on its direction and speed over time. This method updates the position of the projectile and its collider.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the elapsed time in seconds

    • onCollision

      public abstract void onCollision(Entity collisionEntity)
      Handles what happens when the projectile collides with another entity. This method must be implemented by subclasses.
      Specified by:
      onCollision in class Entity
      Parameters:
      collisionEntity - the entity that the projectile collides with

    • clone

      public abstract Projectile clone()
      Creates a clone of the projectile. This method must be implemented by subclasses.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a new Projectile object that is a clone of this one
